name: eldifbd
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wn(wcel(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c2), wn(wcel(c0, c1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wn(wcel(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c2), wn(wcel(c0, c1))))

stmt.origin: sylib(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c2), wn(wcel(c0, c1))), wcel(c0, cdif(c2, c1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c2), wn(wcel(c0, c1))))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cdif(c2, c1)))
-| wb(wcel(c0, cdif(c2, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wn(wcel(c0, c1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wn(wcel(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cdif(c2, c1)))
-| wb(wcel(c0, cdif(c2, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wn(wcel(c0, c1))))

body.origin: |- wb(wcel(c0, cdif(c2, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wn(wcel(c0, c1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wn(wcel(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cdif(c2, c1)))

comment: If a class is in the difference of two classes, it is not in the subtrahend. One-way deduction form of ~ eldif . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
